newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Oct 8.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-factors to watch - Oct 8.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Tuesday morning.
** The Delhi High Court is expected to deliver judgement on former Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao's application against a non-bailable arrest warrant issued against him
The Supreme Court is likely to rule on another criminal
** Tottering equity markets may test year's low after plunging on Monday amid growing worries about political instability
** Slowing export growth due to dropping commodity prices is the main risk faced by investors wanting to put their money into Asian markets, analysts at an investment conference in New York say
** The Unit Trust of India, the country's biggest mutual fund, raised 12 billion rupees during the first quarter ending September 30, 1996, the Financial Express reports
** The spot dollar/rupee INR= opened steady at 35.62/63 per dollar, dealers said
** On Monday, shares plunged across India as political worries triggered panic selling
** The 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index .BSESN closed 98.41 points, or 3.17 percent, lower at 3,002.86 after plunging to 2,939.87
** The 100-share National index .NATEX fell 49.55 points, or 3.55 percent, to 1,345.40
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index .NSEI tumbled 30.12 points, of 3.33 percent, to 874.0
** The 500-share CRISIL index was off 35.12 points, or 5.69 percent, at 582.26
** The Delhi share index dropped 15.73 points to 679.83
** The Calcutta index .CALSN shed 5.22 points to 415.15
** The Madras index .MDSI fell 31.24 points to 3,281.46
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR Index JCEAI lost 3.31 points, or 5.31 percent, to 59.05 with the premium over the local market at 6.86 percent
